summary: An email forwarded by Mark L. Epstein containing a concerning message from an individual identified as 'R O' who claims to have sold information to 'your brother's killers' and expresses worry about Mark's well-being. The document suggests potential threats or dangerous knowledge related to Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Mark L. Epstein
persons.context: Appears as the recipient of a forwarded email from 'R O' expressing concern for his safety and referencing the sale of information to his brother's killers.

persons.name: Stacey Richman
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the forwarded email from Mark L. Epstein, suggesting she may be an attorney or legal contact.

persons.name: Kevin Ponder
persons.context: Mentioned in the subject line as the person to whom Mark L. Epstein should forward the information.

persons.name: R O
persons.context: Sender of the original email expressing worry about Mark L. Epstein's safety and claiming to have sold information to his brother's killers.

connections.description: R O expresses personal concern for Mark L. Epstein's well-being and claims to have had information relevant to him.
Mark L. Epstein is forwarding concerning correspondence to Stacey Richman, likely indicating a legal or advisory relationship.

events.title: Concerning email about information sale
events.description: An individual using the alias 'R O' sends an email to Mark L. Epstein claiming to have sold information to his brother's killers and expressing worry about his safety.

keyFacts: An email from 'R O' claims to have sold information to 'your brother's killers,' directly referencing Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The sender expresses significant concern for Mark L. Epstein's safety, asking if he is okay and to 'take care of yourself.'
The email is forwarded to attorney Stacey Richman and intended for Kevin Ponder, suggesting legal or protective steps are being taken.
